column3: str
If you are here for the Valentione's event, I'm afraid the venue is overcrowded at present. We ask for your patience and understanding.
Greetings and welcome, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>. If you wish to undertake the Valentione's Ceremony, I should be pleased to assist you.
What would you like to do?
Undertake the Valentione's Ceremony.
Learn about the Valentione's Ceremony.
Nothing.
Proceed to the Valentione's Ceremony venue?
What would you like to ask?
What is the Valentione's Ceremony?
What happens in the ceremony?
Tell me about the first trial.
Tell me about the second trial.
Nothing.

The Valentione's Ceremony is a series of light-hearted trials that measure the affinity between two souls. We should be pleased if the ceremony serves as your first step together on the journey of love.
The Valentione's Ceremony is an instance designed for a party of two. There are no class, job, or level requirements for participation.
In the event that you register for the ceremony alone, your partner will be found via the matching system.

The ceremony comprises two trials, which are collectively known as the Trials of the Moon. Overcoming them will require cooperation, communication, patience─such things as form the foundation of a strong relationship.
The Valentione's Ceremony is made up of two mini-games: “Till Mog Do Us Part” and “Cards Beat as One.”
Upon the completion of both, you will receive an affinity rating for your party.

In the first trial, you and your partner must make your way through an obstacle-filled maze. Though you each will have your own path, you must avoid straying far from one another, lest your bond be broken.
In the trial “Till Mog Do Us Part,” you and your partner are joined by a magical chain.

Straying too far from one another will cause the chain to break, during which time the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Affinity<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> bar will slowly drain.
Being attacked by moogles will also drain the bar.
If the bar is completely drained, the duty will end in failure, and you will be ejected from the instance.
Completion time and remaining Affinity influence your final rating while determining your bonus for the second trial, “Cards Beat as One.”
The second trial challenges your powers of recollection and reasoning, while calling on a bit of luck and cooperation for good measure.
The trial “Cards Beat as One” is a card-matching game. Twelve cards will be laid out, and couples must cooperate to turn over matching pairs.
If you guess incorrectly, you will be required to select again until all cards have been matched.
The number of incorrect guesses influences your final affinity rating.
